El negocio se encuentra en el centro de San Salvador, donde inicia su trabajo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6:30 de la tarde, posee mucha competencia, ya que en este lugar existen diferentes tipos de ventas, pero en su mayoría son ventas de ropa en donde los precios son muy competitivos. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder aumentar su inventario, y de esta forma contar con el dinero necesario para comprar por mayor para obtener la ropa y los zapatos a precios más bajos y así vender más barato, lo que le permita contar con más clientes, lo que se traduzca en mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
María Romilia is 60 years old and lives in Soyapango, located in the San Salvador department. María is a very responsible, hard working woman who lives with and supports her two grandchildren; an 11 year old girl and a 10 year old boy. She toils so that they will have all they need to live healthy and happy and to have a bright future. María sells women’s clothing, shoes and slippers, and maternity clothes. Her business is located in the center of San Salvador, where she begins work at 8:00 am and works until 6:30 pm. She has lots of competition, as there are many types of vendors in the area, but most of her sales are because her prices are competitive. She is asking for this loan so that she can expand her inventory and buy at lower prices. She plans to pass the savings on to her customers so that she can increase her sales and income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her inventory

loans.name: Deme Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Dèmè, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fatiana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de condiments, des légumes et des gâteaux.
Ces femmes du groupe Dèmè sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
ROKIA YOUSSOUF D. du groupe Dèmè compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des condiments alimentaires.
Elle s’approvisionne en condiments le plus généralement à Nangola et environnants et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Nangola et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 500F CFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women belonging to the Dèmè group are all married. They have an average age of 40 and on average, two children, and they all live in traditional extended families in the village of Fatiana, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) They met though being related and they sell condiments, vegetables, and cakes. The women who make up the Dèmè group are on their first solidarity loan. ROKIA YOUSSOUF D. who belongs to the Dèmè group intends to use her loan to buy condiments for resale. She buys her supplies mostly in the Nangola area and sells them right there, at the Nangola market and surrounding weekly markets, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 10,500 F CFA which will be used for everyday expenses of her family, reinvesting any remainder into her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments for resale

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba F. is single and has acquired knowledge up to the senior high school level. She sells porridge at a nearby station at Abura where people come to buy the food for their breakfast before going to work. 

Aba will use the loan she hopes to get to purchase more bags of millet for her porridge and to change her table since it is too small for her. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to buy extra bags of millet since the price keeps increasing as time passes by.

loans.use: To purchase bags of millet for making porriadge and to change her table

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto tiene 55 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de acarreo. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio. Con mucho sacrificio ha mejorado su actividad, pues siempre se preocupa por proporcionarle a su hijo estudios que son necesarios, por lo que trabaja de sol a sol para generar ingresos necesarios en su hogar. Por lo que siente muy contento con esta experiencia para mejorar su calidad de vida. El financiamiento que solicita es para la reparación de camión, ya que tiene comprar además ciertos repuestos. Su deseo es llegar a cambiar su camión y obtener otro.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 55 years old and he has been providing trucking services for more than 12 years. He has improved his business with much sacrifice and he wants to be able to provide his son with a good education, which he feels is essential. He works from sunup to sundown to generate the necessary household income. He is happy to be able to improve his family’s quality of life. He is asking for this loan in order to be able to make repairs to his truck and buy some spare parts that he needs. He would like to trade his truck in for another.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Truck repair

loans.name: Keleya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kéléya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fatiana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de poisson frais, de condiments et des légumes.
Ces femmes du groupe Kéléya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des poissons frais, des condiments et des légumes.                   
RABIATA T. du groupe Kéléya compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des condiments alimentaires pour la restauration.
Elle s’approvisionne en condiments le plus généralement à Nangola et environnants et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Nangola et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Kéléya group, all married, are on average 40 years of age and have three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Fatiana, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) They know each other because they are related and they sell fresh fish, condiments, and vegetables. The women of the Kéléya group are on their first solidarity loan which will be used to buy fresh fish, condiments, and vegetables. RABIATOU T., a member of the Kéléya group, intends to use her share of the loan to buy condiments for selling cooked food. She buys the condiments generally in Nangola and surrounding areas and sells right there at the market of Nangola and nearby weekly markets, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 F CFA which will be used for day-to-day family expenses, reinvesting any remainder in her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments for selling cooked food

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kotognontala, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fatiana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, des légumes et des poissons frais.
Ces femmes du groupe Kotognontala sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
MAFILY D. du groupe Kotognontala compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des condiments alimentaires pour la restauration.
Elle s’approvisionne en condiments le plus généralement à Nangola et environnants et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Nangola et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 17 500F CFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Kotognontala group, all married, are on average 41 with three children, and they all live in traditional extended families in the village of Fatiana, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali.) They know each other because they are related, and they sell condiments, vegetables, and fresh fish. The women of the Kotognontala group are on their first solidarity loan. MAFILY D., a member of the Kotognontala group, intends to use her loan to buy condiments for the preparation of cooked food for sale. She buys her condiments generally in Nangola and surrounding areas and sells right there, at the market of Nangola and at weekly markets in the area, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 17,500 F CFA which will be used for day-to-day family expenses, reinvesting any remainder in her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments for selling cooked food

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa E. has received junior high education. She sells mobile phone rechargeable cards at Abura and has been selling rechargeable cards for about a year now. She takes care of herself with the little money she makes from her sales.

Yaa’s loan will be used to buy a variety of rechargeable cards to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in other businesses that will generate more income.

Yaa has in her hand a sample of a Vodaphone scratch card.

loans.use: To buy a variety of rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabali, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 52 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Sontiguila, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de condiments, de charbon de bois, de l’arachide et des poissons frais.
Ces femmes du groupe Sabali sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.  
AWA T. du groupe Sabali compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des sacs de charbon de bois.
Elle s’approvisionne en charbon avec les charbonniers du village et environnants, elle effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Nangola et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 12 500F CFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabali group, all married, are on the average 54 years old and have 4 children; they all live in traditional extended families in the village of Sontiguila, Dioila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other through family ties; their line of business is selling condiments, charcoal, peanuts and fresh fish. The women of the Sabali group are on their first group loan. Awa T., one of the group members, plans to use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal. She purchases her stock from coal merchants in her village and in the surrounding area; she sells out of her home, at the Nangola markets and other nearby markets, for cash or on credit, to a customer base composed of women and men. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 12,500 West African Francs, which will be used towards everyday family expenses, and the rest reinvested in her business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing charcoal [for resale]

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesus

texts.es: Guillermo de Jesús de 40 años, es un hombre trabajador y disfruta mucho de su trabajo. El se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que sus inicios se dan por que su familia anteriormente alquilaba un taxi y Guillermo se dedicaba era quien lo manejaba. El ha se sacrificado mucho por comprar su propio carro ahora que lo obtiene está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de reparaciones que son necesarias. Sus deseos son obtener una nueva unidad de taxi.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 40 years old. He is a hard worker and loves his job. He provides taxi services and has been doing so for more than ten years. He used to rent his taxi, but he has worked hard to be able to buy his own vehicle. He is asking for this loan in order to buy some needed spare parts. He would like to buy a new taxi one day.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabali, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fatiana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce, de condiments, des légumes et des poissons frais.
Ces femmes du groupe Sabali sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
BABINTOU T. du groupe Sabali compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des céréales qui sera transformées en galettes.
Elle s’approvisionne en céréales le plus généralement à Nangola et environnants et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Nangola et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 17 500F CFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabali group are all married, are on average 47 years old with three children, and live in traditional extended families in Fatiana, a village in the Dioïla Prefecture, part of the Koulikouro Region ( 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women in the Sabali group became acquainted through family ties, are retail vendors of condiments, vegetables and fresh fish, and are now requesting their first group loan. Babintou T. wants to use her loan to buy cereal and make flatcakes. She gets her supplies generally in Nangola and the surrounding area, and sells her products locally, at the Nangola market, and at market fairs in the vicinity, for cash or credit, to both men and women customers. She hopes to reach an average monthly income of 17,500 FCFA which will be used to cover her daily family expenses, the remainder being reinvested in commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grain cereal

loans.name: Siguitemasson Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Siguitèmasson, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Sontiguila, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers, de l’arachide, de poissons etc.
Ces femmes du groupe Siguitèmasson sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.  MARIAM D. du groupe Siguitèmasson compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter beaucoup d’articles divers (sucre, thé, huile etc.).
Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises avec les commerçants du village de Nangola, elle effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Nangola et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000F CFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Siguitèmasson group are all married, are 38 years old with four children on average, and all live in traditional extended families in Sontiguila, a village in the Dioïla Prefecture, part of the Koulikouro Region ( 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women in the group became acquainted through family ties, are retail vendors of a variety of products, ground nuts, fish, etc., and are now requesting their first group loan. Marriam D. wants to use her loan to buy a variety of products (sugar, tea, oil, etc.). She gets her supplies from merchants in Nangola, and sells her products locally, at the Nangola market, and at market fairs in the vicinity, for cash or credit, to both men and women customers. She hopes to reach an average monthly income of 10,000 FCFA which will be used to cover her daily family expenses, the remainder being reinvested in commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tièssiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 45 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fatiana sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de poisson frais, de condiments et de l’arachide.
Ces femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                     MARIAM D. du groupe Tièssiri compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des poissons frais.
Elle s’approvisionne en poissons le plus généralement à Dioïla et environnants et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Dioïla et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000F CFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women in the Tièssiri group are all around 45 years old and are married with three children on average; they all live in traditional large households in Fatiana village, the sub-prefecture of Fana, in the Koulikoro region (second largest region in the Republic of Mali). They met through their children and sell fresh fish, condiments and peanuts for a living. They are seeking their first loan, which group member Mariam D. will use in order to buy fresh fish. She generally sources the fish at Dioïla and the surrounding villages, and sells her wares from her stall at the Dioïla market, as well as in the neighbouring markets. She takes cash or credit sales from a customer base made up of both men and women. She envisages generating an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA which would be used to see to her family's day-to-day needs, with leftover funds being invested back into the business.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fish

loans.name: Martha Johanna

texts.es: Martha Johanna tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de recargas telefónicas. Hace más de 4 años, que se dedica a este negocio. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo los cuales estudian por el esfuerzo que Martha realiza. Ella dio inicio por iniciativa propia pues ella tenía la necesidad  de proveerle a su familia el alimento diario, siempre está pensando en la forma como atraer a sus clientes. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para obtener mas recargas en cantidades mayores. Su deseo es mejorar y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha is 37 years old and has been selling phone cards for more than four years. She has two children who are able to attend school, thanks to Martha’s efforts. She started this business on her own initiative because she needed a way to provide for her family. She is always looking for better ways to serve her customers. She is asking for this loan in order to buy larger quantities of phone cards. Martha would like to improve and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Janette Elissa

texts.es: Janette Elisa tiene 2 hijos a su cargo ambos estudia. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de adornos y piñatas además de esto también vende refrescos pues con mucha ayuda está progresando para mejorar. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad, por lo que no es la primera vez que tiene esta experiencia con financiamientos, pues son muy importantes para su progreso. Poco a poco fue incrementando  el número de personas que asistían a su local. Por lo que solicita este crédito para la compra de globos, adornos, calcomanías y una refrigeradora muy pequeña para sus refrescos. Sueña con aumentar sus ganancias cada día.
texts.en:
Janette has two children, both of whom attend school. She makes and sells decorations, piñatas, and soft drinks. With much help, she is progressing. She has been doing this for more than four years. This is not her first experience with financing and it is very important to her progress. Little by little she has increased the number of people working for her. She is asking for this loan in order to buy balloons, decorations, stickers, and a small cooler for her soft drinks. She dreams of increasing her profits every day.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julia Lidia

texts.es: Julia Lidia tiene 49 años. Se dedica desde hace más de 7 años a la venta de mercadería en general,  su negocio goza de muy buena acogida gracias al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes. Por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de renovar su negocio, Julia desea captar más clientes para poder percibir más ingresos y salir adelante, pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse el dinero de una manera humilde y responsable. Ella sueña con poseer una mini tienda que ofrezca una gran variedad de productos. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como ropa, calzado, bolsos, toallas, cosméticos y cremas.
texts.en:
Julia is 49 years old and has been selling general merchandise for more than seven years. Her business is very successful, thanks to the good service she provides to her customers. She is constantly looking for ways to improve her business and wants to attract more customers in order increase her income and come out ahead. She has always liked working and earning an honest living. In the future she would like to open a small store where she can offer a large variety of products. She will use the money from this loan to buy inventory, such as clothing, shoes, bags, towels, cosmetics, and creams.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Maria Concepción  tiene 44 años de edad, ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. Se dedica desde hace 25 años a la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que tiene que salir todos los días  a ofrecer sus productos, el negocio le brinda la posibilidad agenciarse de su propia fuente de ingresos con los cuales solventa sus gastos personales y apoya a su familia. Aunque ha enfrentado muchos desafíos siempre tiene ese carisma pues todo esto ha sido necesario para que ella obtenga experiencia. El financiamiento es para la compra de más productos variados pues actualmente tiene muchos pedidos. Su deseo es terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 year old and has two children. For the past 25 years she has been selling general merchandise and she goes out daily to offer her products. Her business allows her to have her own income to pay her personal expenses and to support her family. Even though she’s had many setbacks, they have been necessary in order to provide her with more experience. She will use the money from this loan to buy more products, as she has many orders to fill. She wants to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying and selling of yams

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina R. y su esposo el señor Pablo Ramírez están muy agradecidos por su cooperación en el anterior crédito.
Solicitan un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar mercancía que le están solicitando mas variedad los clientes, por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión y no quieren descapitalizar el ingreso del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos para ellos ya que son personas mayores.
Desean que su negocio tenga más mercancía para la venta y con una parte de las ganancias plena pagar este nuevo préstamo.
texts.en:
Catalina and her husband Pablo are very grateful for your cooperation on their previous loan. They are asking for a new loan in order to be able to buy merchandise because their customers are demanding more variety. At the moment they do not have the necessary working capital and they do not want to disrupt their business or their income stream, now that they are senior citizens. They would like their business to have more merchandise and they plan to repay this loan with a portion of their new income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Open a small restaurant and purchase food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of generic pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying and selling pagne cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fixing up her salon and selling hair extensions, beauty products, and more

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. sells a variety of soft drinks at Abura. She has been through senior high school. She is married and lives with her two children. She helps her husband to take care of her children.

Ama’s loan will be used to buy additional soft drinks to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy additional soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Adowa

texts.en:
Adowa E. is single and takes care of six children. She has received junior high education.

Adowa operates a provisions shop at Abura and uses the income she gathers from her sales to take care of her six dependents.

Adowa will use the loan to purchase more groceries for her shop. With the new profits from her extended business, she plans to save to further her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her shop

loans.name: Petrona De Las Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Petrona De Las Mercedes se dedica a la venta de quesillos en dos colegios de la ciudad de León por la mañana, por la tarde se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de Avon y ropa usada. Pues es una mujer que le gusta el trabajo y sabe la responsabilidad que como son sus 3 hijos. Su esposo que también aporta ingresos a la familia se dedica a la venta de leña, juntos les enseñan a sus hijos los sacrificios que realizan para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Necesita financiamiento para invertir en la compra de materias prima para la elaboración de quesillos, comprar ropa usada y adquirir más productos de la Avon. Su deseo es mantener activo este medio de ingreso.
texts.en:
Petrona sells cheeses in the morning in two neighborhoods in the city of Leon. In the evening she sells Avon products and second hand clothing. She loves to work and knows about responsibility because she has three children. Her husband also helps to support the family by selling firewood. Together they teach their children about the sacrifices they must make in order to improve their lives. Petrona needs this loan in order to invest in supplies for her cheese making; buy some second hand clothing, and acquire more Avon products. She wants to keep this source of income going.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama P. is a married woman who lives with her husband and four children. She trades in soft drinks at Abura and assists her husband in taking care of her children. She has not received any form of education. Her husband works in forestry at Kakum Forest.

Ama is asking for the loan to buy more soft drinks in greater variety to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks in greater variety to sell

loans.name: Ascención

texts.es:
La señora Ascencion Benitez de 34 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Geroncio Gonzalez de 35 años de edad, ellos tienen 2 hijos que estan cursando sus estudios secundarios.
La Señora se inició en este rubro aproximadamente en el año 2.000; con el capital que llegaron a juntar ahorrando poco a poco del sueldo que su marido percibia, hasta que se decidieron a habilitar una despensa, que en la actualidad ya tiene su clientela formada en el barrio.
Ella invertiría este crédito en comprar más mercaderías (para su despensa); como enlatados, productos de limpieza, lácteos, artículos de ferretería, electricidad, etc., teniendo en cuenta que le falta muchas cosas para satisfacer la demanda de la clientela.
texts.en:
Ascencion is 34 years old. She is married to 35 year old Geronico and they have two children attending junior high school. She started this business in the year 2000, with money that they managed to save up little by little from her husband’s salary. They saved until they had enough to start a small general store. Now they have regular customers in the neighborhood. She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise, such as canned goods, cleaning products, milk products, hardware, electrical parts, etc. in order to better satisfy her customer demands.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying a car for use as a taxi

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina K. is married and has two children. She has been through senior high school. Her husband is a security guard.

Georgina is a seamstress and sells cloth as well at Abura. She has been sewing for some time now and uses her income to support her husband in providing the basic needs of her children.

Georgina will use the loan to purchase more sewing materials for her sewing work and more cloth to sell. She plans to keep the new profits to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials for her sewing work and more cloth to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es:
El señor Geronimo Gonzalez de 31 años de edad, esta casado la señora Antonia Dominguez de 30 años de edad, ellos aun no poseen hijos.
Don Geronimo comenzó con este negocio de la carpinteria aproximadamente en el año 2.006; como propietario, ya que la carpinteria le pertenecia a su padre,  con quien adquirió todos los conocimientos, durante varios años, en la actualidad el tiene personas que trabajan en su carpiteria fabricand muebles para exhibir en su local.
El invertiría este crédito en comprar más Madera; así como clavos, tornillos, cerraduras, etc. Y demás herramientas menores, teniendo en cuenta que su local se encuentra estrategiamente ubicado y tiene buen demanda. De esta forma mejoraría aun más la calidad de sus productos, de forma a incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Geronimo is 31 years old and is married to 30 year old Antonia. They have no children. Geronimo started his carpentry business in 2006. The shop used to belong to his father, from whom he learned everything he knows over several years. He now has people who work for him in his shop, manufacturing furniture to display. He will use the money from this loan to buy lumber, nails, screws, hinges, small tools, etc. This will allow him to improve the quality of his products and increase his income. His shop is located in a strategic location and his services are in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying traditional "pagnes" fabrics for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying grinders and aluminum containers

loans.name: Jairo Josue

texts.es: Jairo Josué tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. El tiene 25 años a pesar de ser tan joven es muy emprendedor. Su actividad es la venta y reparación de bicicleta, hace mas de 12 años pues gracias a la buena localización de su local, tiene mucha afluencia de clientes, el trabajo lo adquirió porque su Papa le enseñaba desde pequeño, con el tiempo a Jairo le gusto y decidió seguir adelante con este negocio. Por lo que siempre está en busca de mejorar las condiciones de su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materiales necesarios para la reparación ya que él tiene que viajar hasta Managua para conseguirlos a un precio más factible.
texts.en:
Jario is 25 years old and has two children. Despite being so young, he is very enterprising. He sells and repairs bicycles and has been doing so for more than 12 years. Thanks to the good location of his business, he has lots of customers. His father taught him when he was a boy and over time Jario decided to move ahead with this business. He is constantly searching for better conditions for his family and is asking for this loan in order to buy bicycle repair supplies. He must travel all the way to Managua to obtain them at good prices.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 51 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de hot dog y gaseosas. Tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 3 están a su cargo, el inicio este negocio hace 5 años, como una alternativa de ingresos para su familia pues él es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta de su trabajo pues todos los días se levanta muy temprano para preparar las compras de los productos que ofrece, el tiene un carretón en donde sus diferentes productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de gaseosas, jugos, pan, salchichas, carne y especies. Su deseo es poder mantener a su familia que para él son muy importantes.
texts.en:
Roberto is 51 years old and sells hot dogs and soft drinks. He has six children, three of whom he still supports. He started this business five years ago as an alternative source of income for his family. He is very responsible, enjoys his work, and he rises early every morning to buy the products he sells from his cart. He will use the money from this loan to buy soft drinks, juices, buns, franks, meat, and spices. He wants to continue to be able to support his family, who is very important to him.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Perseveranda|

texts.es:
La señora Perseveranda D. de 72 años de edad está casada hace 39 años con el señor Ceferino Benítez de 72 años, el matrimonio cuenta con 10 hijos, todos mayores de edad, de los cuales dos hijos varones siguen viviendo con sus padre quienes le ayudan a su mamá en el manejo del negocio de venta de gallinas. 
Su marido trabaja en un aserradero, de esta forma todos se ayudan para llevar adelante los gastos familiares y el negocio.
La señora Perseveranda se inició en este negocio de ventas de gallinas caseras hace 12 años ya cuenta con clientela formada, además hace tortas y en época de verano tiene ventas de helados.
Solicita este préstamo para la  compra de gallinas, gansos patos, que le ofrecen en cantidad a buen precio y así tener  la oportunidad de hacer un buen negocio con la variedad de animales; así también comprar alimentos para engorde de los mismos; por otro lado desea adquirir productos como harina, azúcar e ingredientes para confitería para también incrementar su negocio de venta de tortas y bebidas, y al mismo tiempo incrementar su ingreso.
texts.en:
Perseveranda is 72 years old and has been married to 72 year old Ceferino for 39 years. They have 10 adult children, two of whom still live at home and help Perseveranda in her business; selling chickens. Her husband works at a sawmill. In this way they all pitch in to meet the family expenses. Perseveranda started her home-based chicken business 12 years ago and now has established customers. She also makes “tortas” and sells ice cream in the summer. She is asking for this loan in order to buy chicks, goslings, and ducklings, which she can buy at better prices in quantity, and feed for the animals. This will also allow her to do better business by offering a greater variety of animals. She also wants to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients in order to increase her torta and drink business and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Birds, feed, and supplies

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame N. produces palm oil for sale at Abura and uses the income she is able to make from her sales to support her husband in the paying of school fees and utility bills. She is wonderfully married to a driver and has three children. She has received junior high education.

Maame will use the loan to purchase more palm fruits to process into the palm oil for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more palm fruits to process into palm oil

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: Maria Azucena tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación León 2000 y no es la primera vez que realiza un financiamiento. Desde hace mas de 6 años que se dedica al destace de cerdo, por lo que inicio desde hace 5 años pues es su principal fuente de ingresos ya que así elabora los diferentes productos como frito, pepena entre otros derivados del cerdo, además de tener este negocio ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, pues ha sido muy satisfactorio para ella y su familia. El financiamiento que solicita actualmente es para la compra de materia prima como cerdos por lo que tiene que recorrer grandes distancias en ciertas comunidades para obtener precios favorables. El sueño de Maria es mantener este negocio activo que es su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria has been working with “Fundación León 2000” for a long time and this is not the first time she has gotten a loan. She’s been selling pork for more than six years and five years ago she began making other pork products. She also sells cosmetics. This has all been very satisfactory for her and her family. She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies and more hogs. She has to travel great distance to certain communities in order to get good prices. Maria wants to maintain this business as it is her only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ingrid Jeaneth

texts.es: Ingrid Jeaneth V. V. de 22 años de edad, vive junto esposo y a su único hijo de 4 años de edad, el cual asiste a su primer año de kinder. Ella reside junto a su pequeña familia, en el barrio San Jacinto, ubicado en la capital del país. Ingrid posee una venta de herramientas y electrodomésticos de segunda mano tales como: televisores, hornos tostadores, taladros, planchas, serruchos; así mismo comercializa cables para televisores, controles remotos universales y algunas herramientas más. Este negocio esta ubicado en la avenida Gerardo Barrios, una de las calles más concurridas del centro de San Salvador, en donde muchas personas llegan a buscar diferentes tipos de productos de segunda mano, con el fin de poder encontrarlas a precios más bajos. Ingrid posee este negocio desde hace cinco años, el cual inicio con el deseo de poder brindarle todo el apoyo económico a su esposo y de esta forma contar con una mejor estabilidad económica. Ingrid solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos usados, los cuales se encuentren en muy buen estado, ya que esto le permitirá contar con más clientes los cuales confíen en el buen estado de sus productos.
texts.en:
Ingrid Jeaneth V. V. is 22 years old. She lives with her husband and her only child who is 4 years old, who is in his first year of kindergarten. She resides with her little family in the San Jacinto neighborhood, located in the country's capital. Ingrid has a business selling second hand tools and appliances such as: televisions, toaster ovens, drills, irons and saws. She also sells television cables, universal remote controls and some other tools. This business is located on the Gerardo Barrios avenue, one of the busiest streets in downtown San Salvador. A lot of people go there looking for differernt types of second hand products, with the purpose of finding them at a lower price. Ingrid has had this business for five years. She started it wanting to offer her husband economic support and in this way have better economic stability. Ingrid is asking for a loan to be able to buy a greater quantity of used products that are in very good condition. This allows her to have more clients who trust the good condition of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase used appliances and tools.

location.town: San Jacinto , departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase underwear, fabric, buttons and needles.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia Paredez de 28 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Arnaldo Gomez de 32 años de edad, ellos tienen dos hijas que aun no estan en edad escolar.
Doña Cecilia comenzó como vendedora  ambulante aproximadamente en el año 2.006; con el capital que consiguieron vendiendo unos electrodomesticos, fueron en busca de ofertas a otra ciudad y encontraron que la mejor opción para ellos es la venta de joyas y championes de buena marca, poco a poco fueron afianzandose y en la actualidad ya tienen una buena cantidad de clientes en la ciudad y zonas aledañas y venden sus mercaderias recorriendo varios luhares.
Ella invertiría este crédito en comprar más mercaderías(Championes y Joyas); teniendo en cuenta el pedido que tienen que cubrir.
texts.en:
Cecilia Paredez is 28 years old and she is married with Mr. Arnaldo Gomez, 32, and they have two daughters together who are still too young to go to school. Cecilia started her sales around the year 2006. With savings they earned from the sale of a few home appliances they went to another city in search for good deals. They decided the best option for them was to sell jewellery and brand name clothing. Slowly they started to be known and now they have a good client base in the city and in the suburbs. They sell their merchandise by travelling to different locales. She will invest her loan in the purchase of more merchandise (clothing and jewellery) to fill the orders that have already been placed.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale: athletic shoes, socks, jewellery, etc.

loans.name: Melva Azucena

texts.es: Melva Azucena tiene 41 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ella dio inicio por medio de una amiga que le había dado la idea de iniciar este medio de vida como una fuente de ingresos para su familia, con la ayuda de los financiamientos es que ha logrado mejorar cada día, su ubicación de es de manera ambulante por lo que tiene que salir todos los días y caminar bajo el intenso sol para ofrecer sus productos. Actualmente solicita este crédito para la compra de pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios, sombras, estuches, cremas y colonias. Melva sueña con mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Melva is 41 years old and sells cosmetics. She has been doing this for the past seven years and began after talking to a friend who gave her the idea. With the help of financing, she has been able to improve her business. She must go out every day and walk under the blazing sun to sell her products. She is asking for this loan in order to buy nail polish, lipsticks, shadow, cosmetic bags, creams, and colognes. Melva dreams of improving her family’s economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas de 17 años que se dedica en la venta de medicinas y productos naturales, es por ello que viaja constantemente, en compañía de su esposo, a varias ciudades para venderlos en las ferias comerciales. A cada ciudad que va, tiene un puesto de venta, eso le da ventaja para establecerse el tiempo que dura las ferias en dicha localidad. En tanto cuando tiene que abastecerse de estos productos, tiene que viajar a la ciudad capital para adquirirlos. Con el manejo adecuado de sus ganancias ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo, debido a que sus productos tienen mucha demanda, por tal motivo desea tener una movilidad propia para transportar sus productos a otras ciudades. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y asegura que será muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería y de esa manera aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Alicia is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and children in their own house. For the past 17 years she has sold medicine and natural products. For this reason, she is constantly travelling, along with her husband, to various cities in order to sell products at commercial markets. In each city where she goes she has a booth, which gives her an advantage by allowing her to establish herself in the time that the market lasts in each location. When she needs to stock up on products, she has to travel to the capital city to acquire them. With careful management of her earnings, she has been able to increase her working capital. Because her products are in great demand, she would like to have her own vehicle in order to transport her products to other cities. This is her sixth credit with MFP and she promises to be very responsible with her repayments. She considers this loan to be instrumental in the progress of her business. With the loan that she is soliciting, she will buy more merchandise and in this way increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more natural products.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: Sebastian S. de 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, así mismo vive junto a sus tres hijos de 18, 16 y 11 años de edad, quienes son muy buenos estudiantes. Sebastian posee una granja en la cual cría cerdos y vacas, las cuales posteriormente vende con diferentes clientes. Desde hace 20 años que se dedica a este trabajo, el cual fue un oficio enseñado y heredado por sus padres, así mismo la granja esta ubicada en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual también habita junto a su familia. Sebastian solicita un préstamo para comprar alimentos y vitaminas para su ganado porcino y su ganado vacuno, así mismo desea poder comprar mayor cantidad de vacas y cerdos, ya que gracias a todos sus años de experiencia, Sebastian posee muchos clientes los cuales lo prefieren a él por la excelente calidad de sus animales. Para Sebastian  es de mucha importancia el poder mejorar el estado de su negocio, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta, es por ello que por medio del préstamo hecho a Integral, espera poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sebastian is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children, ages 18, 16, and 11. They are all good students. Sebastian has a farm where he raises hogs and cattle which he sells to different clients. He has been doing this for 20 years and he learned from his parents. The farm is located in the La Libertad department. His family lives there as well. He is asking for this loan in order to buy feed and vitamins for his livestock. He would also like to buy more hogs and cattle. Sebastian has lots of customers who prefer him because of the excellent quality of his animals. It is very important to Sebastian to be able to improve his business, as it is his family’s only source of income. With the help of this loan through Integral, he hopes to improve his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina  tiene 61 años de edad,  se dedica a la venta de ropas en forma ambulante, esta casada con el Sr. Pedro de 51 años , quien es plomero y le ayuda con los gastos familiares, tienen cinco hijos todos mayores de edad e independiente de los cuales dos viven con ellos.
Aquilina inició su actividad hace más de 40 años, vendiendo ropas con su hermano en forma ambulante recorriendo casa por casa, actualmente trabaja con ella un hijo a quien les enseña el oficio de las ventas.
Es muy valorada por su actitud emprendedora, pues desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la venta de dicho producto, gracias a eso y a su buena administración está pudiendo tener una mejor calidad de vida .
Necesita el crédito para la compra de ropas de invierno, como camperas, remeras mangas largas, medias, bufandas, y otros diferentes abrigos de modo a satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y así incrementar sus ingresos
texts.en:
Aquilina is 61 years old and sells clothing. She is married to 51 year old Pedro who works as a plumber and helps with the household expenses. They have five children, all fully grown but two live at home. Aquilina started her business more than 40 years ago, selling clothing door to door with one of her brothers. One of her sons works with them now and she is teaching him the business. She is very valued for her entrepreneurial activities and she has been selling clothing since she was a young girl. Thanks to this and her good management skills, she has been able to have a better quality of life. She needs this loan in order to buy winter clothing, such as jackets, long sleeve shirts, socks, scarves, and other different types of coats to satisfy her customer demand and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Winter clothing inventory

loans.name: Agusto Cesar

texts.es: Agusto Cesar tiene 1 hijo de 5 años a su cargo, por lo que él le brinda la oportunidad de estudio a su hijo. El se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 7 años, cuando el dio inicio fue por su hermano ya que él le proporcionaba los productos para que Agusto los vendiera a precios favorables, así fue como poco a poco ha ido creciendo y mejorando su actividad. Por lo que actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es mejorar cada día con el servicio al cliente así obtendrá mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Agusto has a five year old son, to whom he provides the opportunity for an education. He has been selling clothing for the past seven years. When he began, his brother would provide the products for him to sell. Little by little he has been growing and improving his business. He is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies. He wants to improve his customer service and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Fe Y Accion 1 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of her group Fe y Accion (Faith and Action), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their two children.

Carmen is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she has come to Esperanza because she believes the payment terms are generous and will help her business grow. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a beauty salon by purchasing a barber's chair. She will use the profits to invest in her dream of adding a cosmetic line to her salon as well as saving for the university education of her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a barber's chair

loans.name: Cándida

texts.es:
Cándida tiene 59 años,  se dedica a la venta de verduras, posee un puesto fijo de venta dentro del mercado municipal de Paraguarí, está casada con Agustín Paredes de 65 años.
Empezó a trabajar a los quince años como vendedora de sus padres, de quién aprendio el arte de las ventas y  después de dos años se independizó y habilitó su propio negocio.
 Además tiene cultivos de tomate y locote en finca heredada de sus padres con la ayuda de su esposo.
Es una señora  muy sacrificada, pues su horario laboral empieza a la 4:30hs.  y termina a las 15:00  hs ya que tiene que viajar siete kilometros.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de verduras en general del mercado de abasto de la cuidad de Asunción  pues tiene mucha demanda por la temporada.
texts.en:
Cándida is 59 years old and sells vegetables from a fixed location in the municipal market in Paraguarí. She is married to 65 year old Agustín. She began working as a salesperson for her parents at age 15, from whom she learned the art of selling. Two years later she became independent and started her own business. She also raises her own tomatoes and peppers, with the help of her husband, on land that she inherited from her parents. She is a woman who makes many sacrifices. She travels seven km daily. Her day begins at 4:30 am and she finishes at 3:00 pm. She needs this loan in order to buy vegetables in the Asunción wholesale market. She has lots of demand this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale vegetables

loans.name: Rosabel

texts.es: Rosabel  tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar arduamente en el agricultura, asimismo cría animales vacuno, siendo su método de trabajo, el comprar toros pequeños, que aun están por desarrollar o aquellos que no tienen buen peso, entonces se dedica a su alimentación para engordarlos lo suficiente para luego venderlos a un precio competitivo en el mercado. Por otro lado cuando cosechan papa, éstos son vendidos al por mayor, resultando estas actividades rentables e importante para el ingreso económico de su familia, es por eso que desea incrementar de más animal vacuno. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de abono y también de un toro pequeño.
texts.en:
Rosabel is 27 years old and lives with her husband and son in their own home. All her life she has worked hard in agriculture, she also breeds cattle and buys small bulls that are still developing or those that are underweight and she feeds them to fatten them up and sells them at a competitive price in the market. She also grows potatoes they are sold wholesale. She wants to increase her stock of cattle since it is more profitable and important for her family’s household income. This is her fourth loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) she is very responsible with her payments and considers that it will be very helpful for her business to progress. With the loan she will buy fertilizer and a small bull.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a small bull and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Marcia Del Socorro

texts.es: Marcia Del Socorro tiene 48  años. Por la falta de oportunidades y la desesperante idea de tener dinero para mantener a su familia ella invirtió todos sus ahorros su negocio que es un cafetín, que con mucho esfuerzo ha mantenido por 5 años, pues siempre ha buscado la forma de mantener a su familia. Al ver que le iba bien en la venta de estableció su cafetín ubicado dentro de la estación policial. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y gaseosas. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su local.
texts.en:
Marcia is 48 years old. Out of desperation and lack of funds to support her family, she invested all of her savings into her business, a small café. With great effort, she has maintained it for five years. She has always looked for ways to support her family. Her business is located within the police station. She will use the money from this loan to buy snacks, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and soft drinks. She would like to make improvements to her point of sale.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es:
Damiana vive acompañada con el señor Luis, tienen 2 hijos, uno de 26 años y otra de 24 quienes ya no dependen económicamente de ellos, todos trabajan y aportan en la canasta familiar.
Damiana es una persona muy activa y por fin tiene la oportunidad de lograr su máximo sueño “Tener su casa propia”, pues, su cónyuge consiguió un terreno con facilidad de pago mensuales a largo plazo y ella a través de este apoyo va ir construyendo gradualmente su casa.
Ella es muy emprendedora se dedica en la venta ambulante de empanadas y a cuidar la casa de un vecino en donde le pagan en forma mensual.
Solicita el crédito para incrementar sus ingresos mediante la ampliación de su negocio de venta de empanadas con más variedad  de alimentos rápidos.
texts.en:
Damiana lives with Luis, and they have 2 children. One is 26 years old, and the other 24, and they no longer depend financially on them. They all work and help support the family necessities. Damiana is a very active person, and her goal is to fulfill her greatest dream, which is to own a home. Her partner managed to acquire some land through a long period of monthly payments, and she plans to gradually build a house there. She is very entrepreneurial and dedicates herself to being a street vendor selling empanadas. She also cares for a neighbor’s house, and is paid on a monthly basis for this service. She requests this loan to increase her earnings by expanding her empanadas business into carrying a greater variety of fast foods.as con más variedad de alimentos rápidos.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, eggs, condiments, salsas, bread items, meat, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Rolando Domingo

texts.es: Domingo Rolando su actividad económica es una miscelánea, hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio pues esta es la segunda vez que realiza financiamiento ya que la experiencia ha sido muy reconfortante, pues junto a su esposa ha logrado superar ciertos obstáculos que se le han presentado como la competencia, pues Domingo siempre ofrece muy buenos consejos a sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima. El desea tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Domingo Rolando carries out miscellaneous economic activities. For more than 15 years, he has dedicated himself to this business. This is the second time he has received financing, as the experience has been very comforting. Together with his wife, he has managed to overcome certain obstacles that have presented themselves, such as the competition. Domingo always offers very good advice to his customers. The funds he requests are for the purchase of raw materials. He wishes to have another business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Dilma

texts.es: Dilma tiene 20 años, tiene una hija y vive en casa de sus padres. Hace mas de 3 años se dedica en la venta de animales, que son comprados en zonas rurales y una vez teniendo la cantidad necesaria son llevados los días sábados a las ferias ganaderas para su venta. Su ganancia lo recibe en la semana, y lo que no logra vender lo deja para su consumo propio. Paralelo a este trabajo, también se dedica a cultivar papa. Disfruta mucho de del trabajo que realiza, ya que le permite tener buenas ganancias y con eso cubrir las necesidades de su familia, ahora su mayor anhelo es mejorar su negocio e incrementar su capital de trabajo. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además confía que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más animales como ovejas y toros jóvenes.
texts.en:
Dilma is 20 years old, has a daughter and lives in her parents’ home. For more than 3 years she has sold animals that are bought in rural areas, once she has the quantity needed they are taken to cattle-dealer fairs to sell on Saturdays. Her profits are gathered in the weekdays and what she is not able to sell she leaves to her own consumption. She also grows potatoes. She enjoys her work very much since it allows her to have good earnings and cover her family's necessities. Now her biggest wish is to improve her business and increase her work capital. This is her fourth loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) and she promises to be very responsible with her payments, further she is certain that this contribution will be very helpful for her business to grow. With the loan that she is asking for she will buy more animals like sheep and young bulls.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more sheep and a young bull.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora tiene 38 años. Ella se dedica a  brindar el servicio de molino por lo que hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad, ella dio inicio a este negocio como un medio de vida muy importante para su hogar, por lo que sus vecinos son los que más frecuentan su negocio, Candida además les ofrece una buena calidad en sus molinos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la reparación y mejora de su molino. Su deseo es mejorar el techo de su vivienda el cual está en mal estado.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa is a very happy and hard-working person. She is 38 years old. She dedicates herself to providing a mill/grinding service, which she has been doing for more than 5 years. She started out in this business as a very important part of supporting her home, and her neighbors are the ones that most frequent her enterprise. In addition, Candida offers a very good quality of service. The financing she requests is to make repairs and improvements to her mill. Her wish is to make improvements to the roof of her house, which is in a bad state.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Vicenta Del Rosario

texts.es: Vicenta Del Rosario tiene su actividad económica que es la venta de mariscos. Hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues a pesar de que tiene 59 años tiene muchas energías para salir adelante. Ella inicio esta actividad por su esposo quien anteriormente se dedicaba a esta actividad, pues tenía que mantener a su familia con el paso del tiempo su esposo fallece y ella y sus hijos decidieron hacerse cargo. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como pescados, jaibas, camarones, conchas y punches. Su deseo es tener un establecimiento en donde ofrezca comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Vicenta Del Rosario sells seafood. She has been in this business for 14 years. Despite the fact that she is 59 years old, she has a lot of energy to get ahead. She started this activity because of her husband. He used to sell seafood because he had to support his family. Later, her husband died. She and her children decided to take over the business. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy raw material like fish, blue crab, shrimp, conch, and crab. She wishes to have an establishment where she can make her customers comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To rent new plots of land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital to expand a food business

loans.name: Felíz Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí, Bº San José, se reunieron unas mujeres con ganas de conformar un comité para acceder al préstamo, de ahí se coordinó la reunión para interiorizarse sobre el programa, quienes aceptaron pues era una oportunidad para aumentar su capital de trabajo y recibir capacitación para crecer como persona, ellas son muy trabajadoras, quienes nunca antes han recibido ningún tipo de apoyo crediticia.

Todas las integrantes son señoras muy activas, quienes han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
Una de las señoras, es Doña Isabel quien actualmente es empleada doméstica, y quiere incursionar en un negocio con que puede obtener ingreso y quedarse en su casa, su idea es la de elaborar comestibles y vender a sus vecinos, preparar dulces, masas, empanadas y otros comestibles.

Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes como carne, verduras, dulce para rellenos, condimentos, y otros de manera a comenzar con su actividad.
texts.en:
Some women got together in the city of Paraguarí, Bº San José. They wanted to form a communal bank in order to access a loan. They coordinated the meeting to learn more about the program. They decided to become a communal bank because it was an opportunity to increase their working capital, receive training, and to grow as a person. They are very hard-workers who have never before had any type of help from a loan. All of the members are very active women. They invested their loans in their respective activities. Isabel is currently a domestic employee. She wants to get into a business with which she is able to get income and stay in her house. Her idea is to make food and sell it to her neighbors. She will make sweets, pastries, empanadas, and other food. She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, sweets for fillings, and condiments, to start her activity.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, vegetables, condiments, sugar, sweets for fillings, and other things

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De Los Ángeles tiene 53 años, ella se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella dio inicio cuando comenzó a impartir clases en su vivienda, pues había muchos niños a los que ella les daba clases, así fue cómo surgió la idea de tener de venta este tipo de productos ya que serian muy importantes para su pequeños clientes. Ella solicita esto para la compra de materia prima como cuadernos, reglas, lapiceros, borradores, calcomanías entre otras cosas. su deseo es seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria De Los Ángeles is 53 years old. She sells school supplies. She has been in this business for four years. She began the business when she started to give classes in her house. She taught classes to many children. That is how she got the idea to sell these types of products. They would be very important to her little customers. She is requesting the loan for basic materials like notebooks, rulers, pens, erasers, and stickers, among other things. Her wish is to keep growing with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: David Manuel

texts.es:
David Manuel González G. es un hombre que vive con su cónyuge en el barrio El Carmen del Municipio de Malambo, a 15 minutos  de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Este joven de 28 años, vende mercancías y tiene  un punto de ventas de minutos de llamadas telefónicas, pues es muy común vender minutos a celulares en esta población; como David es un joven muy activo comercialmente, siempre está pendiente de las oportunidades, por eso gracias al clima caliente también es comerciante de sandalias para hombres y mujeres  y  vende pandebonos (tipo de pan hecho de queso con harina de maíz) , que  elabora en el horno que tiene con su hermano y que éste ultimo comercializa  en la  calle.
David ha aplicado por este préstamo  para comprar mas inventario: piensa conseguir 4 docenas de sandalias de hombre, 4 docenas de sandalias de mujer que le han solicitado y para su negocio de pandémonos  1 bulto de harina, 24 libras de queso e ingredientes varios.   

Él comenzó este trabajo hace 12 años con la venta de pandebonos que solía comprar al fabricante y vender en la calle; cuenta que fue muy difícil al principio porque no tenia capital suficiente y el trabajo era duro, por eso se  sacrificó mucho para continuar; fue así como ahorrando, logro comprar su propio horno en sociedad con su hermano y posteriormente  con nuevos ahorros, comenzó a traer sandalias artesanales de San Jacinto un Municipio de  Bolívar para distribuir en los pueblos del Atlántico y agregar otra actividad para obtener mas ingresos: la venta de ropa y otras mercancías y también  hasta logró adecuar en su casa un punto de ventas de minutos a celulares para que su cónyuge trabajara. 

Este es el segundo crédito que David ha recibido de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; desde  que comenzó con esta organización, ha podido abrir nuevos mercados y ampliar la gama de productos que ofrece. Mirando su futuro él espera continuar trabajando para mejor su nivel de vida y  el de su familia adquiriendo una vivienda propia y este es u máximo sueño y desafío.
texts.en:
David Manuel Gonzáles G. lives with his wife in the El Carmen neighborhood in the Municipality of Malambo, fifteen minutes from the city of Barranquilla. This young man of twenty-eight years sells goods, and he also has a kiosk where he sells cell phone minutes. Selling cell phone minutes is quite common in this area. He's a very active young businessman, always on the lookout for opportunities. Thanks to the hot climate he can also sell men’s and women’s sandals. In addition, he makes pandebonos (a bread made with cheese and corn meal) in his and his brother’s oven, and sells them on the street. David has applied for this loan so he can buy more merchandise. He plans to get four dozen pairs of men’s sandals and four dozen pairs of women’s sandals that he has orders for, as well as a sack of meal, twenty-four pounds of cheese, and assorted ingredients for his pandebonos business. David went into business twelve years ago by getting pandebonos from the supplier and selling them on the street. He says it was hard at first because he didn’t have enough capital and the work was hard, so he really had to sacrifice to keep it going. He kept on saving and managed to buy his own oven, in concert with his brother. Later, with his new savings, he started bringing hand-made sandals from San Jacinto, a municipality in Bolivia, to distribute in the towns of the Atlántico department. He added yet another business to increase his income: selling clothing and other goods, and he even succeeded in putting a cell-phone-minutes kiosk in his house so his wife could work. This is David’s second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Since starting out with the organization he has been able to open new markets and expand the range of products that he offers. Looking to the future, he hopes to continue working to improve the quality of life for himself and his family by getting their own house, his greatest dream and biggest challenge.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy inventory, including 4 dozen men's sandals, 4 dozen women's sandals that he has orders for, as well as a sack of meal, 24 pounds of cheese, and assorted ingredients.for his pandebono business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase grocery products

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel tiene 28 años, este joven es muy emprendedor y luchador. Por lo que su actividad es la una joyería. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad, el tiene 1 hija a su cargo y la quiere mucho pues siempre le brinda lo más necesario. Gracias al lugar donde está ubicado su establecimiento ha mejorado su clientela, pues ahora es más visitado. Por lo que el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de oro ya que recientemente tiene muchos pedidos. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su joyería.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel is 28 years old. He is a very enterprising and tenacious young man. He has a jewelry shop. He has been doing this activity for nine years. He has one daughter under his care, and he loves her very much. He always gives her what she most needs. Thanks to his location, the customers in his establishment have improved. Now he has more people visit his shop. The loan he is requesting is to buy gold because he has had many orders recently. His wish is to make improvements in his jewelry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 20 años de edad, quien se dedica a la venta en forma ambulante, es soltero  vive  con sus padres y dos hermanos.
Rolando empezó a trabajar a los quince años como vendedor con un tío, de quién aprendió el arte de las ventas y  después de dos años se independizó y habilitó para su propio negocio. 
Realiza las ventas casa por casa en su moto recorriendo varios kilometros diarios, ya quecuenta con una numerosa clientela por la buena calidad de sus productos y la facilidad en los pagos.
Es un joven muy sacrificado, pues su horario laboral empieza a la 05:00 hs  y termina a las 17:00  hs
Necesita el crédito para la compra de edredones, mantas de lana, colchas y otros pues tiene mucha demanda por la temporada.
texts.en:
Rolando is 20 years old, and sells door to door. He is single and lives with his parents and two brothers. Rolando started working as a vendor along with his uncle when he was 15. His uncle taught him the art of selling, and after 2 years he became independent and was able to have his own business. He sells door to door on his motorcycle, covering a number of kilometers each day. He already has a large customer base because of the quality of his products and the payment terms he offers. He is a self-sacrificing young man, since his working hours start at 5am and end at 5pm. He needs a loan to buy comforters, woolen blankets, pillows, bedspreads and other items that are in high demand this season.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy comforters, woolen blankets, bedspreads, etc. for the winter season at wholesale to re-sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Open a small food stand & buy construction materials

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 49 años, comparte su vida con su esposo y juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace varios años que posee una carpintería donde  realiza todo tipo de muebles y mangos a base de madera, para instrumentos de trabajo, como: picos y palas, que son muy utilizados por los agricultores. En épocas anteriores la venta de estos elementos no tenía mucha demanda por lo que decreció su negocio, es así que empezó con el diseño de muebles que sean económicos y durables, que sean de fácil salida por los clientes. Es por ello que en adelante espera crecer su negocio e implementar con mejores equipo e instrumentos su taller. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP y asegura ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de madera al por mayor.
texts.en:
Elena is 49 years old and shares her life with her husband. Together they live in their own home. For several years, Elena has owned a carpentry workshop where she makes all types of furniture as well as handles for work implements such as picks and shovels, the tools frequently used by farmers. Previously there was not much demand for these items, so her business slowed down. Elena decided to start designing furniture that was durable and affordable so that they can be easily sold to customers. For this reason, she hopes to grow her business and acquire better equipment and tools for her workshop.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Elena is confident that she will be responsible with her payments, since she considers the loan to be useful in advancing her business. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of wood in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood in bulk

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene 46 años, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que con su poca experiencia le han enseñado a mejorar el interactuar con sus clientes. Ella inicio por sus hijos ya que quería brindarles estudios ya que ella no pudo finalizarlos, pero esto no la desanima ya que actualmente tiene un medio de vida. Este crédito será utilizado para la compra de cremas, colonias, pintura de labios y tratamientos para el cabello. Ella sueña con aumentar su negocio y establecerlo en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is 46 years old, and sells cosmetics and clothing. She has had this business for more than 2 years; with a little experience she has learned to interact better with her customers. She started working for her children, since she wanted to provide them with an education. She was never able to finish her own education, but this does not discourage her, since she now has a means of earning a livelihood. This loan will be used to buy creams, colognes, lipstick and hair treatments. She dreams of increasing her business and setting it up in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Pay for restoration of musical instruments

loans.name: Las Sirenas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Sirenas” esta representada por la señora Mirian y conformada por 11 miembros todas mujeres trabajadoras y muy unidas a pesar D. ser su primer ciclo las socias D. este grupo ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios debido a créditos en instituciones similares  ala Fundación Agrocapital. La señora Mirian tiene su venta D. productos varios y también hace pan casero para venderlo en su barrio, su esposo trabaja en el parque industrial en la fábrica D. aceites Sao y tienen 4 hijos en edad escolar y en la universidad, ella desea poder incrementar sus ingresos para poder darle una mejor educación a sus hijos es por esta razón que desea poder incrementar mas su mercadería y aumentar la producción D. pan casero el cual se venD. muy bien en sus barrio. El resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta productos varios como tablillas, empanadas, venta D.  comida, empanadas, refrescos, servicio D. manicura y al alquiler D. carrozas matrimoniales. Las socias tienen mucha competencia como en todo trabajo hay días que se gana y hay días que no pero gracias a su experiencia saben como salir adelante.
