Rosa trabaja de lunes a domingo en su negocio, el cual se encuentra en la entrada del mercado de Usulután, la cual es una posición muy buena ya que muchas personas prefieren no entrar al mercado y compran en las ventas de la entrada, por lo que Rosa posee muy buena clientela, así mismo su gran variedad de productos permite que cuente con diversidad de clientes. Rosa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el poder adquisitivo para surtir el negocio comprando más cosméticos, cremas y productos de primera necesidad, ya que ella desde hace 16 años que se dedica a este trabajo por lo que desea seguir adelante con el y poder mejorarlo y de esta forma obtener mayores ganancias de el, y de esta forma vivir de una forma digna junto a su hija.
texts.en:
Rosa Guadalupe R. D. is 46 years old and sells basic necessities such as toilet paper, rice, sugar, beans, and oil as well as other commercial products such as cosmetics, body crèmes, hair gels, adhesives, earrings, and a variety of other items. She lives in the Department of Usulután with her 17 year old daughter who is in high school. Rosa works Monday through Sunday at her business, which is located outside of the entrance of the market in Usulután. She is in a good position because many people prefer not to enter the market and buy from the vending posts located outside of the entrance. For this reason, Rosa has a good customer base and also offers a wide variety of products that allows her to attract different types of customers.

She is requesting a loan so that she can restock her business by purchasing more cosmetics, crèmes, and basic necessities. Rosa has been in business for 16 years and hopes to continue improving by generating more revenue that will enable her and her daughter to have a decent life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of products to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina T. is from the village of Tangaro, Catarman Province. She is 60 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately $188 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Josefina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials and ingredients for the snack food business that is part of her variety store. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Hermilo

texts.es:
El señor Hermilo M. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo comprar más mercancía para su negocio.
Es solicitando un préstamo para mejorar su vivienda ya que actual mente su techo está en muy mal estado, quiere impermeabilizar antes de que empiece la temporada de lluvia.
Ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Planea pagar el préstamo con el ingreso que está obteniendo de su trabajo como gestor de cobranza de una mueblería.
texts.en:
Sr. Hermilo M. is grateful for the assistance he received from his previous loan, which was used to buy more merchandise for his business.

He is now requesting a home improvement loan. The roof of his house is currently in bad condition and needs to be weatherproofed before the start of the rainy season. Hermilo does not have the money needed to buy the materials and pay someone to make the repairs.

He plans to repay the loan with the income he earns working as a collection manager for a furniture store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for materials & labor to repair his roof

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: Adelina C. B. de 66 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para una empresa privada y junto a un hijo, juntos residen en el departamento de Usulután. Adelina, una señora muy esforzada y trabajadora, posee un tienda de productos perecedero y de productos de primera necesidad, la cual es un gran apoyo tanto para ella como para su esposo ya que es gracias a esta que ellos pueden contar con una estabilidad aceptable en su hogar. Así mismo Adelina elabora platillos típicos como: empanadas, atoles, yuca frita y otros más los cuales vende de forma ambulante por diferentes colonias y ciudades de Usulután. Adelina trabaja muy duro para brindarle una ayuda económica a su esposo, de forma que puedan brindarle todo lo necesario a su hijo, por lo que sus negocios son de mucha importancia, ya que son claves para la estabilidad de su familia. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para la tienda, aumentado aquellos productos los cuales poseen más demanda, así mismo comprar maíz, yuca y otros elementos más para la elaboración de los platillos típicos.
texts.en:
Adelina C. B. is 66 years old. She lives with her husband, who works for a private company, and her son in the Department of Usulután. Adelina is a determined hardworking woman who has a store where she sells perishable products and basic necessities. This business has been a great help to her and her husband because it has allowed them to have an acceptable level of stability in their home.

Adelina also prepare traditional dishes such as empandas, “atole” (a corn porridge), fried cassava, and other items and sells them as a street vendor in different neighborhoods and cities within Usulután. She works very hard to provide her husband with financial assistance so that they can provide their son with everything he needs. This is why her businesses are very important since they are key to her family’s stability.

She is requesting a loan to buy large quantities of merchandise for her store so that she can increase her inventory of those items that are in great demand. Adelina will also buy corn, cassava, and other ingredients for preparing traditional dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store & ingredients for preparing traditional dishes

loans.name: Reyna Amparo

texts.es: Reyna Amparo tiene su actividad como es la venta de prendas como oro y plata. Hace más de 3 años, ella tiene la edad de 49 años, por lo que su inicio fue cuenta propia pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y sacrificarse para su familia, pues ella recorre largas distancias y ahora en la temporada lluviosa, siempre tiene su paragua a mano para protegerse. Ella solicita este crédito para la compra de aretes, pulseras, cadenas, anillos, dijes entres otras cosas. lo que sueña es ampliar sus ventas cada día más.
texts.en:
Reyna Amparo is 49 years old and has been selling gold and silver jewelry for more than three years. She started her own business because she always enjoys working and is willing to make sacrifices for her family, such as traveling long distances. Since the rainy season has arrived, she always carries an umbrella with her to protect herself from the elements.

Reyna is requesting a loan to buy earrings, bracelets, necklaces, rings, pendants, and other items. Her dream is to increase her sales every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase earrings, bracelets, necklaces, rings, pendants, and other items

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El señor Tomas A. ha tenido ya dos créditos con Kiva y con el cual está agradecido por su cooperación en los anteriores préstamo el cual pudo mandar el dinero necesitaba su familiar para las medicinas.  
Solicita nuevamente un préstamo con kiva para poder comprar aparatos eléctricos más moderno y material. Ya que no cuenta con el dinero para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el ingreso D. negocio, porque es la fuente de ingreso de su familia.
El planea pagar el préstamo con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de sus trabajos de reparación y venta de aparatos eléctricos.
texts.en:
Sr. Tomas A. has already had two previous Kiva loans and thanks to the assistance he received from his previous loan, his family had the money they needed to buy medicines.

He is requesting a new loan through Kiva so that he can buy more modern electrical equipment and materials. He does not have the money to make this investment and does not want to drain capital from his business since it the source of income for his family.

Tomas plans to repay the loan using part the earnings he receives from his repair jobs and electrical appliance sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electrical equipment and materials

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María Magdalena C. Z. de 35 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos de 17, 14 y 11 años de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, así mismo vive junto a un cuñado el cual trabaja como sastre, su esposo se encuentra en Los Estados Unidos, en donde trabaja para poder enviarle remesas a su familia. María es una mujer muy emprendedora quien no se cruza de brazos, sino que también trabaja mucho para poder tener una vida mejor y de esta forma ahorrar para cuando su esposo regrese. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa pan, bebidas, crema para el cabello, pasta dental, es un negocio bastante pequeño, el cual tiene todas las intenciones de hacer crecer. Así mismo cada noche trabaja elaborando pupusas, las cuales son un platillo muy típico salvadoreño el cual se hace a base de maíz, frijoles y queso, y así mismo pueda llevar otros ingredientes, ambas ventas estan ubicadas en su casa de habitación en el departamento de San Miguel. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos alimenticios como huevos, más pan, sopas instantáneas y otros más, y también comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima para las pupusas, las cuales poseen gran demanda por tener un buen sabor. Ella se esfuerza mucho para poder contar con una vida mejor junto a sus tres hijos y de esta manera brindarles todo lo necesario a ellos, los cuales son la principal razón para seguir trabajando y esforzarse cada día más.
texts.en:
María Magdalena C. Z. is 35 years old and has three children (ages 17, 14, and 11) who attend school. She currently lives with her brother-in-law, who works as a tailor, since her husband is in the United States for work and sends home monthly remittances. María is an enterprising woman who does not like being idle. She works very hard to have a better life and build up savings for when her husband returns.

Maria manages a store where she sells bread, beverages, hair gels, and toothpaste. Her business is small, but she has every intention to make it grow. In the evenings, she prepares “pupusas” which are traditional in Salvadoran cuisine and made of corn, beans, and cheese, though they can be served with other ingredients. Maria operates both businesses from her home in the Department of San Miguel.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy food products such as eggs, bread, instant soups, and other items. Maria will also acquire ingredients in bulk for making pupusas, since they are in great demand because they taste good. She is determined to provide her three children with a better life and give them everything they need. They are the main reason why she continues to work and invest great effort every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store & ingredients for making pupusas

loans.name: Guadalope

texts.en:
Guadalope B. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She sells foods, snacks, and a variety of clothing. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $185 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Guadalope joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Guadalope is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet B. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 30 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet runs a bakeshop, baking and selling bread in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $227 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which again will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío El Romero del distrito de Mórrope, un distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población ubicada en zonas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque. La zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cuatro años a la crianza y venta de animales: ella cría aves de corral y ganado ovino en la parte posterior de su domicilio, los alimenta con polvillo y pastos naturales y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los vende a los negociantes que visitan el lugar semanalmente. Eventualmente Santos también vende pollos para consumo a las personas que tienen bodegas por la zona y también verduras que compra a los agricultores del lugar para venderlas en las tiendas del pueblo.

Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades son utilizados para ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, en el sostenimiento económico de su familia. Santos desea comprar alimento balanceado para mejorar la crianza de sus animales y percibir mas ganancias al momento de venderlos, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Santos es una mujer activa y que distribuye su tiempo entre las labores de su vivienda y en su trabajo, ella desea crecer como empresaria y seguir apoyando a su esposo en el sostenimiento de su hogar. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad con sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Santos is 34 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the village of El Romero in Mórrope, a district where most of the population live in rural areas that are isolated from one another. The district is located in Lambayeque Province, which is an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Santos has been raising and selling animals for more than four years. She has a pen for raising poultry and also has a designated area behind her house for raising pigs. Her animals are fed ground meal and natural grasses to ensure their development so that they can be sold to the merchants who pass through the village on a weekly basis. Santos also sells chickens to store owners in the area and is a vegetable broker who buys crops from the farmers and sells them to the stores in town.

The earnings from her business activities are used to help her husband, who is farmer, maintain the family’s finances. Santos wants to buy balanced feed to improve the growth of her animals so that she can generate more income when it is time to sell them. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

Santos is an active woman who divides her time between her household activities and her work. She wants to grow as a businesswoman and continue supporting her husband with the household maintenance. Santos has worked previously with Edpyme Alternativa and demonstrated that she is prompt and responsible when submitting her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animal feed

loans.name: Araceli Esperanza

texts.es: Araceli Esperanza tiene 26 años, es una mujer que se siente realizada al tener una familia unida. Hace más de 3 años se dedica a la pulpería, siendo sus principales fuentes de ingresos económicos. Cuando inicio pues con la ayuda de su esposo que mantuvieron de sus ahorros, logro empezar a comprar ciertos productos así fue poco a poco creciendo su negocio y tuvo la oportunidad de comprar una amplia variedad de productos que sus clientes le solicitan. El financiamiento es para golosinas, pan, galletas, refrescos, detergentes, jabón y granos básicos. Desea mejorar cada día aun más su atención para aumentar su clientela.
texts.en:
Araceli Esperanza is a 26 year old woman who feels fulfilled from having such a close family. For three years, she has operated a store as her main source of income. When she started her business, Araceli had the support of her husband who was responsible for managing their savings. She began buying certain products and gradually increased her business to the point that she was able acquire a wider variety of merchandise that her customers requested.

This loan will be used to buy candy, bread, cookies, soft drinks, detergents, soap, and basic grains. She wants to improve her service each day so that she can attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anqueira Esperanza

texts.es: Anqueira Esperanza tiene 50 años, es una mujer muy dinámica y jovial, vive con su esposo. Se dedica en la venta de cosméticos y ropa, por lo que su trabajo lo realiza visitando de casa en casa de sus clientes para ofrecer sus productos, adicionalmente el buen trato que tiene ha hecho que capte mucho compradores. Ella está muy contenta con la actividad que realiza, ahora su mayor anhelo es incrementar sus ventas pues así podrá ayudar más a su familia y sufragar los gastos. Este financiamiento lo realiza con el fin de comprar materia prima. Su deseo es mejorar cada día más.
texts.en:
Anqueira Esperanza is 50 years old and a dynamic jovial woman who lives with her husband. She sells cosmetics and clothing by traveling house to house so that she can visit her customers and offer them her products. In addition, the excellent service she provides has helped her to attract many customers. She is very happy with what she has accomplished. Now her greatest wish is to increase her sales so that she can provide additional help to her family and cover the expenses.

This loan will be used to buy materials. Her wish is to get better each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad A. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old and a widow. She has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, she sells ready-to-wear clothes (RTWs) in her community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $135 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Felicidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely E. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Emely is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Emely owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business is the sale of Avon, Fullerlife, and Natasha products in the local community. Emely has been engaged in her business for over 12 years, and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities. She also has a food stall, where she sells specialty foods and snack foods.

In 2009, Emely joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Emely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Emely is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Emely from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sokhen

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhen, S. ( in photo) 27, and her husband, Mr. Phanna So, 33, have been married since 2001. They have two sons. One of them attends school and another one is still too young for school. Besides her sons, she also has her elderly mother living with her.  

Sokhen has been a garment factory worker for six years, while her husband has been an electrician for ten years. The couple is in the process of building their new house but they lack funds to finish part of it.  So, Sokhen is requesting her first loan of US$ 700 to in order to complete their house.

loans.use: To finish  building her house.

loans.name: 07.02.01 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
"Hien N. T. (14) is a 30 year old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa, in Thanh Hoa.  Hien is the group leader of a 4 member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 07.02.01 Hoang Hoa (07.02.01 Hoang Hoa).


Hien is married and has 2 infant-aged children.  To making a living, Hien operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattL. for saL..  Hien has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Hien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.626.900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 3.079.800 VND which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. T. Duong (39) is a 26 year-old woman who is requesting a 3.079.800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  N. T. Ha (3) is a 41 year-old woman who is requesting a 3.079.800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  N. T. Ly (6) is a 38 year-old woman who is requesting a 3.079.800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Thong

texts.en:
Mrs. K. is an older woman whose husband has dead of senility years ago. She now is the mother of nine children, four are married and the other five are single. She receives a little income from her four children who are employed at different jobs.  

K. has been engaged in an own business selling rice for years. She owns a shop inside the local market, where she sells rice for both retail and wholesale supply. In addition to her current trade, K. takes time to cultivate a rice crop when the farming season comes. To help alleviate some of the hard physical labor, K. requests a loan of US$500 to be used to purchase a cow to plow the farmland.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to plow the farmland.

loans.name: Tsedevsuren

texts.en:
Tsedevsuren, 31, lives with his wife and 4-year-old daughter in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent).  Tsedevsuren operates a wooden products manufacturing business. He participated in a carpentry training course in 2002 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has since started his own wooden products manufacturing business. Between 2003-2005, Tsedevsuren and his brother worked together to manufacture wooden products. 

After Tsedevsuren's wife graduated college, they moved together to Uvurhangai province. Tsedevsuren worked as a gas distributer  at an Umbar gas station between 2005 and 2009. In 2009, he went into business for himself again, and reopened his wooden product manufacturing business at  a rented workplace in a business development center in Uvurhangai province. In 2010, he built his own workplace on his own plot of land and started making wooden products, furniture, and ger parts. He is an experienced and skillful wooden products manufacturer, and a hardworking person. Tsedevsuren operates grocery store in from his yard as well.  Tsedevsuren says, “It feels great to enjoy the results of hard work. I am working to operate different businesses.”

 He is requesting a 2,290,000 MNT loan to purchase timber and other necessary materials for his business.

loans.use: to purchase timber and other necessary materials for a woodworking business

loans.name: 06.03.05 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en: Thuc L. T. (31) is a 52-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoang Hoa, Thanh Hoa. Thuc is the group leader of this three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 06.03.05 Hoang Hoa (06,03,05 Hoang Hoa). Thuc is married and has three school-aged children. She operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month. In 2005, Thuc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,124,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Thuc is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 6th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. B. T. Ngong (30) is a 54-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 2,124,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. L. T. Hanh (35) is a 36-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Thuc L. T. (31) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa ,Thanh Hoa. Thuc là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 06,03,05 Hoang Hoa (06,03,05 Hoang Hoa). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương. Thuc thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thuc kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND. Vào 2005, Thuc đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thuc đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2,124,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. B. T. Ngong (30) là 54 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2,124,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. L. T. Hanh (35) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3,079,800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao C., 57, is married with three children living at home in Takeo province. She grows rice and works as a musician, typically making US$2 each day. Her husband, Svay Heng, pictured here, makes musical instruments and raises pigs and typically makes about US$2 each day.

Sao C. would like a loan of US$1,200 to create a new investment. She plans to open a store selling beer and meat in the village and allow her children to operate it.

loans.use: To open a store selling beers and meat for her children to operate

loans.name: 05.02.12 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
"Tu C. T. (65), a 52 year-old female living in the town of H. Hoa, Thanh Hoa, is the leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 05.02.12 H. Hoa (05.02.12 H. Hoa).

Tu, who is married and has three adult -aged children, raises cattle for sale. Engaged in this business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 200.000 VND a month. In 2010, Tu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tu is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in the amount of 3.079.800 VND to purchase baby livestock to raise and later sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. H. T. Hien (66) is a 30 year-old female requesting a 3.079.800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2. N. T. Anh (67) is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 3.079.800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3. L. T. Thuong (33) is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 3.079.800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

loans.name: Enhjargal

texts.en:
Enhjargal N., 33, is married and the mother of two children. She and her family live together in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, in a small house which they own. Enhjargal and her husband operate a sun glasses trading business at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Mongolia. She has been selling sun glasses during the summer and leather gloves during the winter since 2001. Enhjargal purchases the gloves from local Mongolian producers and in Ereen, a Chinese border town.  She purchases her gloves from Mongolian wholesalers. Enhjargal has gained much experience over the past nine years. She sells her product from four locations in the market. Enhjargal employs her husband's sister to sell her products at one of the locations. 

Enhjargal is an enthusiastic person who has a great business mind. In February, 2010, a thief stole furniture from Enhjargal's home. Therefore, she purchased new furniture using capital from her business. She is requesting  34,000,000 MNT loan to maintain her small house for her family needs.

loans.use: to maintain her small house

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn N. is 45 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where she operates a small business selling groceries from home. In addition, Sorn N. built a pigpen where she raises a few pigs for extra income. She is widowed and the mother of two teenage kids, both of whom are no longer in school, and they currently work in different field. Sorn N. is a hard-working woman who never wastes time in order to earn money to ensure that the family has a better life. Sorn N. is taking out her first loan to support her in the farming activity and to buy grocery inventory for her shop.

loans.use: To support her in the farming activity and to buy grocery inventory for her shop

loans.name: Galbadrah

texts.en:
Galbadrah N., 47, lives with his wife and two children in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent) in Arhangai Province, Mongolia. His 11-year-old son attends a local primary school, while his daughter, Arvinjargal, attends a local kindergarten. The family has been living in their current home for 19 years.

Galbadrah and his wife operate a clothes-selling business at a local market, an enterprise he started in 1990 with working capital of 300,000 MNT. After years of successful operation, his working capital is now 1,700,000 MNT. He began receiving XacBank services in 2002, and has a good credit history. Galbadrah is planning to expand his business in the future and operate a mobile clothing trading business in the countryside. An industrious person, he would like to increase his business profit and revenue and so is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase an array of clothing in Ereen, a Chinese border town.

loans.use: To purchase clothing apparel for his business

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum N., 54, is a widow and resides with her daughter in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. She and her daughter sell fruit at a local market for a gross income of about 24 USD per day. N. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to buy more fruit for resale. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. N. appears in the photograph at CREDIT's office.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to resell

loans.name: Gunjinlham

texts.en:
Gunjinlham B. 34, is married and the mother of three children. She and her family live in Arhangai province, Mongolia in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent) in a rented yard. Gunjinlham and her husband run a shoe repair service. Since 1998, when she began helping with her father's shoe repair service, Gunkinlham has gained great experience. Her working capital is 250,000 MNT. 

Gunjinlham has been planning to purchase her own house and plot of land with a yard from her business profits. She is an industrious person, and is always grateful that her father has enabled her to support her family by teaching her to repair shoes. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary materials for her shoe repair service.

loans.use: to purchase materials for shoe repair

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi M., 60, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She is a housewife and her husband is a farmer who grows rice. They earn an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Two of the children are employed at a local company,  each earning an income of USD 100 per month to help the family.  

M. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to buy clothes for one of the children to resell at the city. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell at the market

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her two oldest sons, aged 22 and 20, are university students. Her daughter, Davaahuu, attends a local secondary school. Ariunaa's family has been living in their current home for 20 years. Ariunaa and her husband operate a clothing trading business from a rented counter at a  local wholesaling trading center. She started her business in 2005 with a working capital  of 600,000 MNT. In only five years Ariunaa has managed to increase her working capital to 1,200,000 MNT. 

Since she started operating her business, her family's living condition has improved.  Ariunaa has been providing money towards the family expenses and can afford to pay for her children's education fees. She is an open person who has great communication skills. Ariunaa says, “My dream is one day to create my own workplace.” She is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan to  expand her selection and to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing inventory to resell

loans.name: 06.01.22 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
"Ty N. T. (108) is a 58 year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa ,Thanh Hoa.  Ty is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 06.01.22 Hoang Hoa (06.01.22 Hoang Hoa).

Ty is married and has 3 adult -aged children.  To make a living, Ty operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Ty has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Ty joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise.  The loan will be her 6th loan taken out from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ty plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  C. T. Ket (134) is a 58 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector, operating a fishing business.

2.  N. T. Hanh (107) is a 25 year-old woman who is requesting a 5.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector, operating a fishing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Gandolgor

texts.en:
Gandolgor is 28 years old and lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family  live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent).  They have been living together in their current home for six years. Gandolgor operates a clothing trading business. She has been operating her business since 2007 and has steadily expanded her business. Gandolgor started her business with a working capital of 300,000 MNT. After three years of successful operations her working capital today stands at 7,000,000 MNT. She is planning on renting a retail counter in the future. 

Since Gandolgor started operating her business, her family's living conditions have improved. Gandolgor has been providing money for her family expenses. She is an open person with great communication skills. Gandolgor is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of clothing in Ereen, a Chinese border town, to resell  in the countryside.

loans.use: To purchase clothing apparel for her business

loans.name: Yem

texts.en: Yem K., 40, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells chilli for a gross income of $25 US per day. Her husband is a teacher, earning an income of $2.60 per day to help cover the family expenses.  K. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy more chilli and clothes to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more chilli and clothes to resell

loans.name: 02.09.05 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Ngoi C. T. (026) is a 54 year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa, Thanh Hoa. Ngoi is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.09.05 Hoang Hoa (02.09.05 Hoang Hoa).

Ngoi is married and has three adult children. Ngoi operates a family member's livestock business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. Ngoi has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 700,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) a month from it.

In 2004, Ngoi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Ngoi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. She is now requesting a new loan, her fifth, of 5,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Ngoi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. L. T. Hien (25) is a 32 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

2. C. T. Thao (28) is a 51 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ngoi C. T. (026) là 54 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa, Thanh Hoa. Ngoi là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có three các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.09.05 Hoang Hoa (02.09.05 Hoang Hoa).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Ngoi thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Ngoi kiếm được khoảng 700,000 VND. Vào 2004, Ngoi đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Ngoi đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là fifth khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. L. T. Hien (25) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2. C. T. Thao (28) là 51 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Dok

texts.en: Dok C., 50, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells food for an income of $13 US per day. Her husband is a butcher, earning an income of $1 per day to help cover the family expenses.  C. is requesting a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a new business as a motor-taxi driver. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Nymdavaa

texts.en:
Nyamdavaa B., 50, lives with his wife and two sons in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). His oldest son, Anhbayr, attends a vocational training center. His youngest son, Erdenebat, attends a local secondary school. 

Nyamdavaa operates a wooden furniture manufacturing business. He has been operating his business since 2004, and has steadily expanded his business over the past six years. Nyamdavaa's initial working capital was only 40,000 Mongolian Tugrug (MNT), but after years of successful operation his working capital stands at 800,000 MNT today. With his business profit, Nyamdavaa has used 1,000,000 to purchase a house and plot of land with a yard for his family. Nyamdavaa is an skillful manufacturer and very hardworking person. He says, “I always try to make high quality products for my customers. ” He is requesting a 1,100,000 MNT loan to purchase more timber for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for his business

loans.name: Muth

texts.en: Muth S., 52, is widowed and resides with three children in the Kampong Chnang province of Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She is a tailor and earns an income of $2 USD per day. One of her daughters is a garment factory worker, earning an income of $2 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $900 USD to repair her house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her current business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly B., 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in the Kampong Chnang province of Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells food for an income of $2 USD per day. Her husband is a blacksmith, earning an income of $5 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. B. is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work and to repair the house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her business selling food. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and repair the house

loans.name: Dorjsuren

texts.en: Dorjsuren S., 49, lives with his wife and four children in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). Dorjsuren operates a dairy-product trading business. He has been operating his business since 2006, and has steadily expanded his business over the last four years. Dorjsuren started his business with working capital of 200,000 MNT, but with a lot of hard work and determination, his working capital has increased to 1,500,000 MNT today. Dorjsuren purchases his products in Bulgan soum, and resells those products at the Hasu trading center. He has gained much experience in previous years and has built a loyal customer base. Dorjsuren is an honest person and focused on the future. He would like to expand his business. Dorjsuren is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Vong

texts.en: Vong S., 29, is married and resides with her husband and three children in the Kampong Chnang province of Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She is a garment factory worker and earns an income of $2 USD per day. Her husband operates his truck to transport garment factory workers, earning an income of $5 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 USD to buy a new truck to transport the workers. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new truck to transport workers from the factory

loans.name: 06.02.09 Hoang Hoa Group

The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dung  plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Oam

texts.en:
Oam C., 26, is married and resides with her husband and a young child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She sells snacks at a primary school for an income $7.50 US per day. Her husband is a taxi driver and a mechanic, earning an income of $2.50 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

C. is requesting a loan of $600 to buy car spare parts to expand her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: buy car spare parts to expand the mechanic business

loans.name: 04.10.06 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Tham P. T. (79) is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa, Thanh Hoa.  Tham is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 04.10.06 Hoang Hoa  (04.10.06 Hoang Hoa).

Tham is married and has 3 children.  To make a living, Tham owns & operates a business venture making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community.  Tham has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2.500.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2000, Tham joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tham has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3.079.800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  This will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tham plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

2.  N. T. Loan (105) is a 50-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

3.  P. T. Hieu (103) is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

Tham P. T. (79) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa , Thanh Hoa.  Tham là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 04.10.06 Hoang Hoa  (04.10.06 Hoang Hoa ).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm nung trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tham thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tham kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2000, Tham đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tham đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần T.ết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

2.  N. T. Loan (105) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  P. T. Hieu (103) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna S. is from the village of Capatan, Tuguegarao City. She is 55 years old. Edna is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a business managing food production and sales. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling cacao balls for food. Aside from that, she also manages a hog-raising business. Edna has been engaged in her businesses for more than 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Edna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. Edna is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients needed to make more products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Edna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed to make more products to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 60 years old widowed and mother of nine children. Two of her children attend school.

She is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. She has been farming for 44 years and has one employee. Her main products are beans, bananas, maize and tea which she sells at the local market and to the Kenya Tea Development Authority. Her major challenge is a lack of finances for expansion.

Sarah has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES.45,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow that will provide enough milk to sell and for her grandchildren to consume.

She appreciates the loan.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is 60 years old. He is married with 8 children aged between 14 and 31 years old. Six of his children are currently attending school. He is a farmer from western Kenya, in Kisii town. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 35 years. 

Ben's products are maize, tea, bananas, and millet which he sells to institutions and local markets. He also earns income from sale of milk and he has a pension being a retired extension officer. His main challenges are lack of a ready market, the poor transport network, and family needs which at times make him divert money to educate his children.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of Kes 30,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to get manure from the cow; the nutritional status of the family is going to improve from the consumption of milk, and he is also going to get extra income from the sale of milk.

In five years, he hopes to start a greenhouse for vegetables and tomatoes. He also hopes to buy a pickup truck to use for transporting his products to the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia S. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 42 years old. Alicia is married and has one school-aged children. To make a living, Alicia owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as candies, eggs, noodles, salt, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 14,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Alicia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a farmer from Kisii town, in Western Kenya where she has been working for 22 years old.  She employs two people.  Her main products are maize, beans and tea that he sells in the local market and to the Kenya Tea Development Authority.  She also operates a retail shop where she sells grains, fertilizers and animal feed.

Grace is 50 years old. She is a widowed mother of six children, ages 12-27.  All but one attend school.

Her main challenge is to transport her farm produce to markets which is hindered by poor roads.

She requests this loan from Juhudi Kilimo (KES.45,000) to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  The income from this loan will enable her to educate her children and improve her family's financial status.  In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila N., from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur, is a 60-year-old widow with two adult-aged children. To make a living, Lucila owns and operates a business venture manufacturing and selling clothing products to local businesses and community members. Engaged in her business for over 20 years, she earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lucila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products, Lucila is requesting a new loan, her fifth, of 15000 PHP to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad O. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 64 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Caridad owns and operates a business making and selling food, preparing and selling banana cue (deep-fried banana covered with caramelized brown sugar) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Caridad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Caridad is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her fifth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: 04.09.02 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Lien H. T. (89) is a 32-year-old femaL. living in the town of H. Hoa, Thanh Hoa. She is the group leader of this seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 04.09.02 H. Hoa (04,09,02 H. Hoa).

Lien is married and has two infant children. She owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in this business for over five-years and earns approximately 600,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 4,248,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. The loan will be her first from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Lien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. L. T. Hoa (90) is a 19-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.

2. L. T. Thanh (91) is a 33-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4.248,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

3. L. T. Duyen (32) is a 36-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4.248,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

4. T. T. Thuy (27) is a 33-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

5. N. T. T. (92) is a 31-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.

6. T. T. Cuoi (93) is a 57-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her manufacturing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


*****************************************************
Lien H. T. (89) là 32 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố H. Hoa , Thanh Hoa. Lien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 04.09.02 H. Hoa (04.09.02 H. Hoa).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Lien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Lien kiếm được khoảng 600.000 VND. Vào 2010, Lien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Lien đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. L. T. Hoa (90) là 19 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.

2. L. T. Thanh (91) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.

3. L. T. Duyen (32) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.

4. T. T. Thuy (27) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5. N. T. T. (92) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

6. T. T. Cuoi (93) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie M., 51, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Jose M., a Barangay Councilor, and they are blessed with two children. Annalie makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been into managing their own Internet cafe for quite some time now.

Annalie has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Her good repayment performance with her previous loans means she was able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her business. 

To ensure the success of her business, Annalie would like to apply for a loan of 10,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying additional computer units for their Internet cafe.

Annalie dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education and be able to acquire their own house and lot.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional computer units for her Internet cafe

Joelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC.
